content: 1 make a chainless foundation row of 80 hdcs total note for the last chainless half_double_crochet you will need to join this stitch at the base to the first chainless half_double_crochet so that the first round is properly joined 2 slip_stitch into top of first chainless half_double_crochet to complete the round stitch count 80 hdcs in a round textured brim rounds round 1 bphdcstndst in the first foundation half_double_crochet stitch then work bphdc over the post of each stitch around and then slip_stitch into the bphdcstndst stitch count 80 bphdcs rounds 2 to 55 repeat round 1 for each of these rounds except commence with bphdcstndst over the previous round bphdcstndst stitch count 80 bphdcs note do not fasten_off brim finishing round either use the other end of the yarn or come back and complete this round after the basket weave beanie has been made rotate the beanie 180o so that the foundation round is now the upmost round ensuring that you continue to work right side only join the yarn in the chain in the base of the first half_double_crochet foundation stitch you will now be working in the opposite direction from rounds 2 to 5 outwards from the opposite side of the foundation round fphdcstndst over the first half_double_crochet foundation stitch post then work fphdc over the post of each stitch around and then slip_stitch into the fphdcstndst fasten_off yarn leaving a long tail and then sew in the yarn end securely basket weave pattern rounds if the brim finishing round was last worked rotate the hat so the foundation round is down most follow beanie first brim next instructions note in round 1 you will be 4 if you prefer not to use a chainless foundation then work 80 chains using a 4 5 mm hook and then slip_stitch into first chain to form circle then switch to a 4 mm hook and work the 80 hdcs around with a slip_stitch to complete the first round 5 note construct additional repeats if a deeper brim is preferred for men s size add an additional 2 to 3 repeats page | 6 messy hair bun/ pony tail option if the hccn is in the middle of two factors of eight use the smaller factor as the beanie will stretch for example if the hccn is 75-76 chain then use 72 chain as the work as per pattern above but instead finish beanie after round 24 slip_stitch in each afcn rather than 80 chain ensure you work the brim with a slightly looser gauge stitch around to neaten the finish alternatively work a round of single_crochet over a small to than you d typically use or alternatively go up a quarter to half a hook size to medium size elastic hair band work the brim 3 if the hccn and afcn are discrepant by more than ~4 cm/ ~1 6 then you may basic resizing tips wish to use the tailored method there are three resizing options dk tailored
